item.title: Influences
item.description: pAncharAtra kAshmIri (eg. keshava of kramadIpa) is prominent. mAdhva connection The idea of Gauḍīya Vaiṣṇavam even having a mantra-sambandha with the Madhva Sampradāya is controversial, let alone any sort of doctrinal linkage… The earliest source mentioning such a connection is Gaura Gaṇoddeśa Dīpikā, and even there is it nothing more than a mantra paramparā. Madhavendra Purī, Īśvara Purī, and Mahāprabhu himself all took ekadaṇḍa sannyāsa. Folk influence The “eastern” bit might be “sarasvatI as spouse of viShNu” type (presumably originally folk) stuff.
